title: Work - graph of force vs displacement

content.question: In an experiment, a horizontal force is exerted on a cart as it moves along a straight, horizontal track with negligible friction. Several trials are performed, and in each trial the total work done on the cart is the same, but the magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> of the applied force and the distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> that the cart is pushed are varied. Which of the following graphs best represents how <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> depends on <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a graph of 8 data points in a 6 by 5 gridded plane with the horizontal axis labeled d and the vertical axis labeled F. The data points begin one half unit to the right of the vertical axis and 5 units above the horizontal axis. The next data point is 1 unit to the right of the vertical axis and 2 and half units above the horizontal axis. The remaining data points follow a path curving down slightly to the right and ending 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and less than one unit above the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of 8 data points in a 6 by 5 gridded plane with the horizontal axis labeled d and the vertical axis labeled F. The data points begin one half unit to the right of the vertical axis and 5 units above the horizontal axis. The next data point is located half a unit horizontally to the right of the first data point. After that the data points then fall down and to the right, gradually at first and steeply as the data points get closer to the horizontal axis.  They end 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and less than one unit above the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of 8 data points in a 6 by 5 gridded plane with the horizontal axis labeled d and the vertical axis labeled F. The data points begin one half unit to the right of the vertical axis and 5 units above the horizontal axis. The data points then fall straight down and to the right, ending 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and less than one unit above the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a graph of 8 data points in a 6 by 5 gridded plane with the horizontal axis labeled d and the vertical axis labeled F. The data points begin one half unit to the right of the vertical axis and one half unit above the horizontal axis. The data points then climb straight up and to the right, ending 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and 5 units above the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows a graph of 8 data points in a 6 by 5 gridded plane with the horizontal axis labeled d and the vertical axis labeled F. The data points begin one half unit to the right of the vertical axis and 5 units above the horizontal axis. The next data point is 1 unit to the right of the vertical axis and 2 and half units above the horizontal axis. The remaining data points follow a path curving down slightly to the right and ending 4 units to the right of the vertical axis and less than one unit above the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
